div.div: Hydrographic sections across the Kerguelen jet.
div.p: Colors show vertical sections along the green transect in Fig. 1A of time-mean ( A, D, and G) zonal velocity (meters per second), ( B, E, and H) buoyancy frequency (per second), and ( C, F, and I) salinity (psu), for the perturbation experiments with wind stresses of (A to C) 0.5*τ, (D to F) τ, and (G to I) 2*τ. White contours are time-mean isopycnals, and the green line is the time-mean mixed layer depth. The black feature is the northern slope of the KP. The red patch in (H) marks a region of time-mean convection. Horizontal sections of time-mean buoyancy frequency (per second) on a log 10 scale at a depth of 120 m, chosen to represent the depth of the base of the SML, for the perturbation experiments with wind stresses of ( J) 0.5*τ, ( K) τ, and ( L) 2*τ. Hovmöller diagrams of zonal surface velocities along the green transect in Fig. 1 for ( M) 0.5*τ, ( N) τ, and ( O) 2*τ.
